poem:
### Reset

In the corridors of power,  
a whisper, a pause—  
what do we want?  
Dreams, sometimes tangled,  
drift across channel tides.  
Keir's words must bridge  
this quiet, patient sea,  
as Brussels waits,  
hope flickering like  
a candle in the wind.  
Define the reset,  
before fog rolls in—  
underline, clarify, unite.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK government must say what Brussels ‘reset’ means, says EU delegation head Keir Starmer’s government must spell out what it wants from a reset of Britain’s relationship with the EU, the European parliament’s lead MEP on the UK has said. In his first interview since being elected chair of the European parliament’s delegation to the EU-UK parliamentary partnership assembly earlier this month, Sandro Gozi, an Italian former European affairs minister, said there was potential for". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
